Béatrice Chevallier Caseau is Professor in Byzantine History at the University of Paris –Sorbonne and a member of the Centre d’Histoire et Civilisation de Byzance. Her publications explore religious anthropology and sacred spaces of the late antique and Byzantine periods and include Euodia: The Use and Meaning of Fragrances in the Ancient World and Their Christianization (100 –900AD
She is coeditor of Pèlerinages et lieux saints dans l’Antiquité et le Moyen âge

title: Alice-Mary Talbot is a former Director of Byzantine Studies at Dumbarton Oaks Research Library and Collection. Her research has focused on Byzantine monasticism and hagiography, and women’s studies. Her most recent books are: Women and religious life in Byzantium (2001); The History of Leo the Deacon
